speaker: Teacher
text: Class, we're going to switch our project approach today. Instead of solar energy models, I'd like you to create digital presentations.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: Wait, what? We already started building the model!

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: Yeah, I spent three hours last night working on the panel design... Can we still use some of that work?

speaker: Teacher
text: I understand you're frustrated, but we need to adapt. The science fair format changed.

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: Okay... I guess we could take photos of what we built and put them in the presentation? Then at least that work isn't wasted.

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: That's actually a really smart idea Marcus! We could show our process.

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: Thanks. I'm not great with presentation software though. Emma, you're good at that stuff - could you help me learn? I can teach you about the construction parts in exchange.

speaker: Emma Johnson
text: Deal! We could work on it together after school tomorrow.

speaker: Sarah Chen
text: I'm still annoyed about the change, but Marcus your idea does make it better.

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: I get it, I was frustrated too at first. But I think if we show our building process, our presentation might actually be more interesting than just slides.

speaker: Teacher
text: Marcus, I appreciate how you turned that frustration into a constructive solution.

speaker: Marcus Williams
text: Thanks. I learned from my soccer coach that you can't control what happens, just how you respond to it.
